binaryOption.toolTip: Used to start a scan when software trigger mode is selected

This flag is set if the result register of the enabled electrode is out
 of the range defined by the TSI_THRESHOLD register. 
 This flag is set only when TSI is configured in non-noise detection mode.
 It can be read once the CPU wakes. 
 Write 1 , when this flag is set, to clear it.
This bit specifies if the current sources of electrode oscillator and reference oscillator are swapped

choiceOption.toolTip: Enables and selects between software triggered or automatic hardware scanning

binaryOption.toolTip: Controls operation while in Low Power Modes (STOP, VLPS, LLS and VLLS{3,2,1})

choiceOption.toolTip: Enables events from Out-of-Range and End-of-Scan conditions

Enables events from Out-of-Range and End-of-Scan conditions\n It may also be used to direct OOR events to generate interrupts rather than DMA requests.\n DMAEN may still be used to direct EOS to interrupt or DMA requests.

choice.name: Interrupt/DMA enabled on Out of Range
Interrupt/DMA enabled on End of Scan
Interrupt on OOR, DMA on EOS

binaryOption.toolTip: Select between DMA and Interrupt request\n This bit is used together with the TSI interrupt enable bits(TSIIE, ESOR, EOSDMEO)\n to generate a DMA transfer request instead of an interrupt.

choiceOption.toolTip: Number of Consecutive Scans Per Electrode
Control the electrode oscillator charge and discharge current value
Controls the reference oscillator charge and discharge current value

choiceOption.description: TSI analogue modes setup and status bits
choiceOption.toolTip:
Set up TSI analogue modes
 Mode[3..2] == 00 => Capacitive sensing mode
 Mode[3..2] != 00 => Noise detection mode
 When reading this field will return the analogue status

binaryOption.toolTip: This flag is set when all active electrodes are finished scanning\n after a scan trigger.\n Write 1 , when this flag is set, to clear it.
This read-only bit indicates if scan is in progress.\n This bit will get asserted after the analogue bias circuit is\n stable after a trigger and it changes automatically by the TSI.

intOption.toolTip: Determines the high threshold for the wakeup channel active in low power mode
Determines the low threshold for the wakeup channel active in low power mode
Threshold to use as default when creating single inputs (buttons)

choiceOption.toolTip:
This specifies the input channel to be measured.
 In hardware trigger mode (TSI_GENCS[STM] = 1), the scan will not start
 until the hardware trigger occurs.
 In software trigger mode (TSI_GENCS[STM] = 0), the scan starts immediately
 when TSI_DATA[SWTS] bit is written by 1.

intOption.toolTip: These read-only bits record the accumulated scan counter value ticked by the reference oscillator.
